metadata.key_specifications: AEC-Q100 qualified automotive single 2-input positive-AND gate with open-drain output, 2 V to 5.5 V operating range, 10-μA max ICC, 6 ns max tpd at 5 V, ±8-mA output drive at 5 V, 250 mA latch-up performance
metadata.applications: Combining power good signals, enabling digital signals

page_summaries.content:
SN74AHC1G09-Q1 Automotive Single 2–Input Positive-AND Gate With Open-Drain Output

1 Features
• AEC-Q100 Qualified for automotive applications:
– Device temperature grade 1:
–40°C to +125°C, TA
– Device HBM ESD Classification Level 2
– Device CDM ESD Classification Level C6
• Operating range from 2 V to 5.5 V
• Low power consumption, 10-µA maximum ICC
• Maximum tpd of 6 ns at 5 V
• ±8-mA output drive at 5 V
• Latch-up performance exceeds 250 mA per JESD 17

2 Applications
• Combining power good signals
• Enable digital signals

3 Description
The SN74AHC1G09-Q1 is a single 2-input positive-AND gate with an open drain output configuration. The device performs the Boolean logic Y = A × B in positive logic.

5 Pin Configuration and Functions

Figure 5-1. DBV or DCK Package, 5-Pin SOT-23 or SC70 (Top View)

Table 5-1. Pin Functions
PIN
TYPE(1) DESCRIPTION
NAME NO.
A 1 I Input
B 2 I Input
GND 3 — Ground
VCC 5 — Power pin
Y 4 O Output
(1) I = input, O = output
Figure 7-1. Load Circuit and Voltage Waveforms

8.1 Overview
The SN74AHC1G09-Q1 device contains one open-drain positive-AND gate with a maximum sink current of 8 mA. A wide operating range of 2 V to 5.5 V enables this device to be used in many different systems, and a low tpd qualifies this device to be used in high-speed applications.

9.2 Typical Application

Figure 9-1. Typical Application Diagram

9.2.3 Application Curves
Figure 9-2. ICC vs Input Voltage

9.3 Power Supply Recommendations
The power supply can be any voltage between the minimum and maximum supply voltage rating located in Recommended Operating Conditions. 
Each V CC pin should have a good bypass capacitor to prevent power disturbance. For devices with a single supply, a 0.1-μF capacitor is recommended; if there are multiple V CC pins, then a 0.01- μF or 0.022-μF capacitor is recommended for each power pin. It is acceptable to parallel multiple bypass capacitors to reject different frequencies of noise. 0.1-μF and 1-μF capacitors are commonly used in parallel. The bypass capacitor should be installed as close to the power pin as possible for best results.

9.4 Layout
9.4.1 Layout Guidelines
When using multiple bit logic devices, inputs must never float. In many cases, functions or parts of functions of digital logic devices are unused (for example, when only two inputs of a triple-input AND gate are used, or only 3 of the 4 buffer gates are used). Such input pins must not be left unconnected because the undefined voltages at the outside connections result in undefined operational states.

Product Summary.content: SN74AHC1G09-Q1 Automotive Single 2–Input Positive-AND Gate With Open-Drain Output is an AEC-Q100 qualified device for automotive applications with a temperature range of -40°C to +125°C. It has a low power consumption of 10-μA maximum ICC and a maximum propagation delay (tpd) of 6 ns at 5 V. The device features an operating range from 2 V to 5.5 V, ±8-mA output drive at 5 V, and latch-up performance exceeding 250 mA per JESD 17.

The SN74AHC1G09-Q1 is a single 2-input positive-AND gate with an open drain output configuration, performing the Boolean logic Y = A × B in positive logic. It is suitable for applications such as combining power good signals and enabling digital signals.

The SN74AHC1G09-Q1 device contains one open-drain positive-AND gate with a maximum sink current of 8 mA. Its wide operating range of 2 V to 5.5 V enables it to be used in many different systems, and its low propagation delay qualifies it for high-speed applications.

Electrical Characteristics.content: Figure 7-1 shows the load circuit and voltage waveforms for the electrical characteristics of the component. The load circuit diagram illustrates the configuration for measuring various electrical parameters such as voltage, current, and power specifications.

The voltage waveforms depicted in Figure 7-1 provide insights into the timing characteristics of the component, including rise and fall times, pulse widths, and propagation delays. These timing parameters are crucial for understanding the component's performance in various applications.

In addition to the load circuit and voltage waveforms, the electrical characteristics section may include tables or graphs presenting specific values or ranges for parameters like supply voltage, input/output voltages, input/output currents, and power consumption under different operating conditions.

The electrical characteristics data, including the load circuit, voltage waveforms, and tabulated specifications, enable designers to evaluate the component's suitability for their application requirements, ensuring proper integration and reliable operation within the desired electrical constraints.

Application Circuits.content: 9.2 Typical Application: This section likely provides information about a typical application circuit or implementation example for the electronic component being described. It may include a circuit diagram (Figure 9-1) and details about the typical usage or configuration of the component.

9.2.3 Application Curves: This subsection likely contains graphs or plots (such as Figure 9-2, which shows ICC vs Input Voltage) that illustrate the performance or behavior of the component in a typical application scenario.

9.3 Power Supply Recommendations: This section provides guidelines and recommendations for properly powering the electronic component. It covers topics such as acceptable supply voltage ranges, bypass capacitor selection and placement, and best practices for ensuring a stable and clean power supply for the component.
9.4 Layout: This section discusses layout considerations and guidelines for effectively implementing the electronic component on a printed circuit board (PCB) or in a system design.

9.4.1 Layout Guidelines: This subsection likely provides specific recommendations and best practices for laying out the component on a PCB, such as ensuring proper input connections, avoiding floating inputs, and other layout considerations to ensure proper operation and functionality.

Packaging Information.content: The text provides information about the pin configuration and functions of a 5-pin SOT-23 or SC70 package. It includes a diagram showing the top view of the package and a table listing the pin names, numbers, types (input/output), and descriptions.

Details are given for tape and reel packaging, including reel dimensions, tape dimensions, and quadrant assignments for pin 1 orientation in the tape. Specific dimensions are provided for the SN74AHC1G09QDBVRQ1 and SN74AHC1G09QDCKRQ1 packages in tabular form.

Tape and reel box dimensions are listed for the two package types, including length, width, and height measurements. The text also includes detailed package outline drawings with dimensions for both the SOT-23 (DBV) and SC70 (DCK) packages.

Example board layout and stencil design guidelines are provided, with notes on solder mask tolerances, alternate design recommendations from IPC standards, and potential variations based on the board assembly site.

The information covers key aspects of packaging for these specific component types, including physical dimensions, tape and reel specifications, and guidelines for PCB layout and stencil design during board assembly.
